originalText.text: I had an exceptional experience at Skin Spa, both at their Midtown and Flatiron locations. The welcoming atmosphere, coupled with knowledgeable staff, made my visits truly enjoyable. The team's patience in listening to customer concerns stood out, and sessions with Sylvia in Midtown and Daphne in Flatiron were always a pleasure. From the manager to the entire staff, everyone exudes professionalism and friendliness.

text.text: I had an exceptional experience at Skin Spa, both at their Midtown and Flatiron locations. The welcoming atmosphere, coupled with knowledgeable staff, made my visits truly enjoyable. The team's patience in listening to customer concerns stood out, and sessions with Sylvia in Midtown and Daphne in Flatiron were always a pleasure. From the manager to the entire staff, everyone exudes professionalism and friendliness.

originalText.text: Wanted to love it, but it wasn't the experience I was hoping for. I wish I had been explained the process throughout the facial, what skincare was being applied, etc. I felt a bit judged through my consultation when I asked for some care to be taken with my face since I have shoots coming up. A friend recommended another location, which I may try instead next time.

I wish I had been explained the process throughout the facial, what skincare was being applied, etc. I felt a bit judged through my consultation when I asked for some care to be taken with my face since I have shoots coming up. originalText.text:
Don’t waste your time. They do the bare minimum with laser & will leave you with random streaks of hair because they don’t cover the full body part you’re paying for. They even leave very large surfaces untouched if it’s too close to a different body part, despite it still being a part of the body part you’re getting serviced.

Besides still using gel for laser?? What year is Skin Spa in. 2015 is long gone. But I’d take annoyance of the gel if they actually covered the full body part you’re paying to have serviced.

Not worth the price, service, & attitudes they also have here. And with all that, they still think people should pay 20% tip for an expensive service that last literal minutes.

Not worth the price, service, & attitudes they also have here. And with all that, they still think people should pay 20% tip for an expensive service that last literal minutes.

originalText.text:
Please don't come here for laser hair removal. I came in May for a half-leg laser hair removal, and I left with permanent burn marks on my ankles and lower legs. When I called them, they said to come in so their aesthetician could look at the burn marks and see what could be done. They gave me some sunscreen and moisturizer and said that it'd go away. 5 months later, and it hasn't. I even consulted with my dermatologist, and she said it likely would be permanent as leg scars don't go away easily.

While it's tempting to save money and get a deal at Skin Spa, I regret not spending more and going to a board certified dermatologist. The staff at Skin Spa tried to refund me initially, but the permanent damage to my skin is not worth $100. Their customer service is so, so bad, it's shocking. The back and forth over email and phone calls (and many left voicemails) just is not worth it. Please save your skin and go somewhere else.

originalText.text: I enjoy going to Skin Spa every time. I always receive excellent service. On my recent visit Olga M. who provided the service went above and beyond by walking me through my facial and how I can maintain at home. I really appreciated her wealth of information and her warm demeanor. I am recurring client and definitly will continue being one.
